DOC.brief_summary: OBJECTIVE : This study evaluate serum vascular endothelial growth factor ( VEGF ) concentration woman ectopic pregnancy ( EP ) , abnormal intrauterine pregnancy ( aIUP ) normal intrauterine pregnancy ( nIUP ) . METHODS : This prospective , case-control study compare serum VEGF concentration among 72 woman ectopic pregnancy ( n=35 ) , abnormal IUP ( n=15 ) normal IUP ( n=22 ) match gestational age . For determination serum VEGF concentration solid phase sandwich ELISA use . Patients stratify accord serum VEGF 200pg/mL . RESULTS : The serum level VEGF significantly high woman ectopic pregnancy ( median 211.1 pg/mL ; range 5 - 1017.0 pg/mL ) woman normal IUP ( median 5 pg/mL ; range 5- 310.6 pg/mL ) P < 0.0001 . Serum VEGF concentration show statistically significant difference woman aIUP ( median 231.9 pg/mL range 5 - 813.7 pg /mL ) EP ( median 211.1 pg/mL range 5 - 1017.0 pg/mL ) . When cut-off concentration 200 pg/mL VEGF use , nIUP could distinguish unviable ( EP aIUP ) sensitive 53 % , specificity 90.9 % , positive predictive value 92.9 % negative predictive value 46.5 % .. CONCLUSIONS : Serum VEGF could distinguish EP aIUP . However , serum VEGF concentration 200 pg/mL could discriminate nIUP unviable pregnancy ( EP aIUP ) PPV 92.9 % .
DOC.brief_title: Are Serum Levels Vascular Endothelial Growth Factor Marker Early Diagnosis Ectopic Pregnancy ?
DOC.criteria: The inclusion criterion presence transvaginal ultrasound extraovarian adnexal mass woman suspect ectopic pregnancy ( amenorrhea , bleed pain ) positive test betahCG . The exclusion criterion nontubal ectopic pregnancy ( cervical , cesarean scar , ovarian , abdominal ) .
